definition: to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And therein lies the problem for this self-made billionaire.
sentences.chinese: 這個白手起家的億萬富翁也面臨着問題。

sentences.english: Cai says his Horatio Alger story is “typical of Wenzhou.
sentences.chinese: 蔡說，他的白手起家的故事是一個”溫州的典型“。

sentences.english: She came to this country, and she started a laundry business from nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她來到這個國家，白手起家，辦起洗衣店。

sentences.english: He baked the torte from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 他從烤果子奶油蛋糕白手起家。

sentences.english: Smith has worked the firm up from almost nothing.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯幾乎是白手起家，搞起了這家公司。

sentences.english: Inventing such a camera wouldn't be easy, but Cameron said he wasreadyto break new ground.
sentences.chinese: 發明這種像機絕非易事，但卡梅隆決定白手起家。

sentences.english: They've been created from scratch and they're very successful.
sentences.chinese: 他們是白手起家的，現在很成功。

sentences.english: The beauty of starting a Web business is that you can do it on a shoestring.
sentences.chinese: 創辦網絡的好處在於你可以白手起家。

sentences.english: Starting bare-handed , you have built up so many steel plants. This is nothing short of miraculous.
sentences.chinese: 你們白手起家，修建了許多鋼鐵廠，這簡直是個奇蹟。

sentences.english: He started from scratch, developing a small factory into an internaational business group.
sentences.chinese: 他白手起家，把一家小工廠辦成了跨國企業。

definition: to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
to begin an undertaking/to start a major task/to initiate/to venture/venture/entrepreneurship
multi-millionaire
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
to be penniless
to work hard/to try to make a living
billionaire/multimillionaire
to win success and recognition (idiom)
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
family property
rich and powerful person
rich person/millionaire/billionaire
to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by
big shot/top gun/superstar/VIP
